question.text: Grammar books often divide structures with if into three types: the so-called ‘first, second and third conditionals’. Choose the best analysis of this approach.
option: All structures with <item>if</item> can be explained in terms of these three sentence types.
Some, but not all, structures with <item>if</item> can be explained in terms of these three sentence types.
Structures with <item>if</item> can never be explained in terms of these three sentence types.
question.answer: Some, but not all, structures with if can be explained in terms of these three sentence types.
